comment: Hands down one of my favorite professors and one of the easiest college classes I've taken. He uses a point system instead of a traditional scale and gives a ton of extra credit. Attendance is not mandatory but his lectures are very interesting, so I would recommend still going for that reason. Easy tests, online quizzes. Not a lot of work.

The textbook will help you with the tests, but it isn't really necessary if you take good notes. His built in extra credit is awesome, if you do all the extra credit you will do well in the course. I ended the year with a 116% in the class.

This class was amazing. One of the few classes that I left feeling like I've actually learned something and not just been put through a tremendous amount of stress for nothing. I highly recommend this class to anyone that needs to take Psych 1101. There is minimal homework and lots of chances for extra credit.

TAKE HIM. I had heard that psychology 1101 was a tough class but Dr. Podchaski made it fun and relatively easy. I finished with over a 100 in the class because of all the extra credit he offers. I rarely went to class for the last half of the semester because he puts everything online. Put a little effort in and you'll be fine!

i was really nervous about psyc because I'm not the best test taker, especially in a science, but he makes so much extra credit available I never got an A on one of his tests but received a 100.65% in the class! TAKE HIM!!!! do ALL the extra credit you won't be dissapointed!

I barely showed up to class. He posts everything he does in class in D2L. SOOO many extra credit point, I think like 200 and they are super easy ways to get points. Tests aren't too hard. If you even kind of review you'll be fine I got C's on all the tests and got a 106 in the class. DEFINITELY TAKE HIM!

He's great. PSY 1101 was a breeze, he made it so easy. You learn everything from slides and videos, you don't even need to buy the book. You watch a lot of the videos and he answers any and all questions. He's so easy to talk to, and really sweet and funny.

TAKE HIM!!!!! He makes this class very fun and his lectures stick out because he doesn't read exactly what's on the powerpoint. He has a bunch of extra credit opportunities, so if you do bad on a test, don't worry. The tests aren't difficult, but they aren't a cakewalk. If you review a little bit everyday, you will be just fine.

He is a great guy and gives you lots of extra credit opportunities! He gives substantial info and posts the lectures on D2L. He cares about you and your grade and his class is perfect. He makes it fun and its not insanely difficult! If you come to class and take notes you will do great! LOVE this guy!!!

This is the one of the best professors I have ever taken. He is extremely sweet and makes the class enjoyable and entertaining. All the notes are on slides he puts on D2l. He also gives a lot of extra credit which really helps if you're a bad test taker. I would highly recommend taking him for your intro to psych class and any other class he has.

I would definitely take his class again. He was super easy, gave ALOT of extra credit. You really have to try to fail. Make sure you study it's a lot of information but if you pay attention in class and take notes you'll be fine. Easy A.

Super nice and some topics are interesting. His tests aren't hard and he is very clear about what is on them. He doesn't take attendance and his power points are online. There's discussions and trivia questions that aren't hard and he has workshops before tests. Most of the stuff we need to do for class count as extra credit if you do all of it.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I'm pretty surprised his rating isn't higher. I've loved having him. There's extra credit through out the semester, bonus points on tests, and online quizzes with 2 attempts. He's relatable and easy to understand.
Professor Eric is a nice teacher, but his class is super hardd.  The course load is demanding and the group project is a killer.  Not a good choice for a psychology elective.

I thought this class would be fun but the workload is just no doable.  If you are not in a good group, you are doomed for the semester. 4 tests with no curve, lots of discussion.  I do not recommmend this professor.

engineering psychology is very challengingg.  You have group projects that are harshly graded with attendance part of your grade.  Tests are hard and projects are very difficult.  It is the work of 2 classes.  Not  a good choice for elective.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Professor Eric is a great professor and makes the class easy and fun to learn. His powerpoints and study guides prepare you very well for the exam so you don't NEED the book but if you want to get it thats okay too. He really knows his stuff but understands its an intro class so he makes it easy to learn. DEF take him if you can!!!

Dr. Eric is super sweet and cares about your grade. He provides so many easy extra credit opportunities, lectures are all online, and his tests are really easy to study for. He has workshops where you get into small groups and complete an assignment the day before each test, and they're easy and quick to get through. TAKE HIM!

Mr. Podchaski is such a sweet and laid back guy. He is really caring of his students and provides extra credit opportunities throughout the semester. He posts all of his powerpoints, review sheets, and quizzes online on D2L which are very helpful for the exams. Although he does assign some busy work, they are in order to get you an easy A. Take him

I took Dr. Eric for Psych of Aging and it was such an easy easy. His lectures are a little boring because he always gets lost in his little anecdotes. But he's really nice, willing to help. All tests were open book too(:

Amazing professor. He relates his power-points back to real life scenarios, so its easy to remember.  Loved the discussion posts because it enables you to strengthen and or build a bond with someone older than you, such as your grandma or dad. He also gives a lot of extra credit.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Lots and lots of extra credit

Super nice guy. Enthusiastic. Sometimes skims through Powerpoint slides, but it was a night class, so everyone was tired and he wanted to get out early. Very generous on quizzes and exams. Out-of-class interviews and discussion posts were fun. Reading was a bit dry.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: His voice is a bit different but still a nice guy. He gives out lectures every day and all of his lectures are online so you can stay at home/ skip. His study guides are very similar to the tests and tests are very easy to remember.
